queryCondition.queryText:
CrowdStrikeDetections
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
| where Tactic == "Execution" or Technique has "T1204"
| where SeverityName in ("High", "Critical")
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    Name,
    Description,
    SeverityName,
    Tactic,
    Technique,
    UserName,
    SourceAccountUpn,
    Filename,
    Filepath,
    Sha256,
    Md5,
    Cmdline,
    Device
| extend
    AccountUpn = SourceAccountUpn,
    DeviceName = tostring(Device.hostname),
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(tostring(TimeGenerated), Name, tostring(Device.hostname))))

displayName: Lab Stage 3.5 Internal Port Scan Detected (Palo Alto)

queryCondition.queryText:
CommonSecurityLog
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
| where DeviceVendor == "Palo Alto Networks"
| where DeviceEventClassID == "TRAFFIC"
| where Activity in ("drop", "deny", "end")
| where ApplicationProtocol == "incomplete"
| summarize
    DistinctPorts = dcount(DestinationPort),
    DistinctHosts = dcount(DestinationIP),
    SessionCount = count(),
    FirstSeen = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastSeen = max(TimeGenerated),
    SourceHostName = take_any(SourceHostName)
    by SourceIP, SourceUserName
| where DistinctPorts > 20
| extend
    TimeGenerated = FirstSeen,
    AccountUpn = SourceUserName,
    DeviceName = SourceHostName,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(SourceIP, SourceUserName, tostring(DistinctPorts))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 3.5 - Internal port scan detected via Palo Alto
alertTemplate.description: A host scanned more than 20 distinct ports across internal hosts, indicating network reconnaissance. Stage 3.5 of the Lab attack chain (T1046).

description: Detects a suspicious Okta login from a foreign country followed by privilege escalation within 15 minutes. To add markUserAsCompromised response action: join IdentityInfo on AccountUPN to resolve AccountObjectId (requires Defender for Identity).

queryCondition.queryText:
let login_events = OktaV2_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
| where EventOriginalType == "user.session.start"
| where OriginalOutcomeResult == "SUCCESS"
| where SrcGeoCountry != "AU"
| project LoginTime = TimeGenerated, ActorUsername, SrcIpAddr, SrcGeoCountry, SrcGeoCity, ActorSessionId;
let priv_events = OktaV2_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
| where EventOriginalType in ("user.account.privilege.grant", "system.api_token.create", "user.session.impersonation.grant", "user.mfa.factor.deactivate")
| where OriginalOutcomeResult == "SUCCESS"
| project PrivTime = TimeGenerated, ActorUsername, EventOriginalType, EventMessage, SrcIpAddr;
login_events
| join kind=inner priv_events on ActorUsername, SrcIpAddr
| where PrivTime between (LoginTime .. LoginTime + 15m)
| project
    LoginTime,
    PrivTime,
    ActorUsername,
    SrcIpAddr,
    SrcGeoCountry,
    SrcGeoCity,
    PrivilegeAction = EventOriginalType,
    ActionMessage = EventMessage
| extend
    TimeGenerated = LoginTime,
    AccountUpn = ActorUsername,
    RemoteIP = SrcIpAddr,
    AppName = "Okta"
| extend ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(tostring(LoginTime), ActorUsername, SrcIpAddr)))

alertTemplate.title: Account takeover by {{ActorUsername}} from {{SrcGeoCountry}} [Okta]
alertTemplate.description: An Okta user logged in from a foreign location and performed privilege escalation within 15 minutes (T1078.004 + T1098). This pattern is consistent with compromised credentials used for post-compromise activity.
alertTemplate.recommendedActions: Immediately suspend the user account. Revoke all active sessions. Reset credentials and MFA. Investigate the foreign IP address.

displayName: Lab Stage 6 Large Data Exfiltration (Palo Alto)

queryCondition.queryText:
CommonSecurityLog
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
| where DeviceVendor == "Palo Alto Networks"
| where DeviceEventClassID == "TRAFFIC"
| where Activity == "end"
| where isnotempty(DestinationIP)
| where ipv4_is_private(DestinationIP) == false
| where SentBytes > 10000000
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    SourceIP,
    DestinationIP,
    DestinationPort,
    SentBytes,
    ReceivedBytes,
    ApplicationProtocol,
    SourceUserName,
    SourceHostName,
    DeviceAction
| extend
    SentMB = round(SentBytes / 1048576.0, 2),
    AccountUpn = SourceUserName,
    DeviceName = SourceHostName,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(tostring(TimeGenerated), SourceIP, DestinationIP, tostring(SentBytes))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 6 - Large data exfiltration to external IP
alertTemplate.description: Palo Alto firewall detected a session sending more than 10 MB to an external IP. This indicates potential data exfiltration. Stage 6 of the Lab attack chain (T1041).

displayName: Lab Stage 7 AWS IAM Escalation and Suspicious Cloud Activity

queryCondition.queryText:
let suspicious_events = dynamic([
    "ConsoleLogin",
    "CreateUser",
    "AttachUserPolicy",
    "AuthorizeSecurityGroupIngress",
    "RunInstances",
    "GetObject",
    "StopLogging"
]);
AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(2h)
| where EventName in (suspicious_events)
| summarize
    EventSequence = make_set(EventName),
    EventCount = count(),
    FirstEvent = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastEvent = max(TimeGenerated),
    SourceIPs = make_set(SourceIpAddress),
    UserArn = take_any(UserIdentityArn)
    by UserIdentityUserName
| where EventCount >= 3
| where set_has_element(EventSequence, "CreateUser") or set_has_element(EventSequence, "AttachUserPolicy") or set_has_element(EventSequence, "StopLogging")
| extend DurationMin = datetime_diff('minute', LastEvent, FirstEvent)
| project
    FirstEvent,
    LastEvent,
    DurationMin,
    UserIdentityUserName,
    EventSequence,
    EventCount,
    SourceIPs,
    UserArn
| extend
    TimeGenerated = FirstEvent,
    AccountUpn = strcat(UserIdentityUserName, "@pkwork.onmicrosoft.com"),
    RemoteIP = tostring(SourceIPs[0]),
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(UserIdentityUserName, tostring(EventCount), tostring(FirstEvent))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 7 - AWS IAM escalation and suspicious cloud activity
alertTemplate.description: An AWS IAM user performed multiple suspicious actions including account creation, policy attachment, or disabling CloudTrail. Stage 7 of the Lab attack chain (T1078, T1098, T1496, T1562.008).

displayName: Lab Stage 8 AWS Backdoor Account Login from Creator IP

queryCondition.queryText:
let account_creations = AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(2h)
| where EventName == "CreateUser"
| extend CreatedUser = tostring(parse_json(RequestParameters).userName)
| project CreationTime = TimeGenerated, CreatorUser = UserIdentityUserName, CreatedUser, CreatorIP = SourceIpAddress, UserIdentityArn;
let new_user_logins = AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(2h)
| where EventName == "ConsoleLogin"
| where tostring(parse_json(ResponseElements).ConsoleLogin) == "Success"
| project LoginTime = TimeGenerated, LoginUser = UserIdentityUserName, LoginIP = SourceIpAddress;
account_creations
| join kind=inner new_user_logins on $left.CreatedUser == $right.LoginUser
| where LoginIP == CreatorIP
| where LoginTime > CreationTime
| project
    CreationTime,
    LoginTime,
    CreatorUser,
    CreatedUser,
    SharedIP = CreatorIP,
    UserIdentityArn
| extend
    TimeGenerated = LoginTime,
    AccountUpn = strcat(CreatedUser, "@pkwork.onmicrosoft.com"),
    RemoteIP = SharedIP,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(CreatorUser, CreatedUser, SharedIP, tostring(LoginTime))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 8 - AWS backdoor account logged in from creator IP
alertTemplate.description: A newly created IAM user logged into the AWS console from the same IP address used by the account that created it. This is a strong indicator of persistence via a backdoor account. Stage 8 of the Lab attack chain (T1136.003, T1078.004).

displayName: Lab Stage 9 GCP IAM Privilege Escalation and Resource Abuse

queryCondition.queryText:
let suspicious_methods = dynamic([
    "google.iam.admin.v1.CreateServiceAccount",
    "google.iam.admin.v1.CreateServiceAccountKey",
    "SetIamPolicy",
    "v1.compute.firewalls.insert",
    "v1.compute.instances.insert",
    "google.logging.v2.ConfigServiceV2.DeleteSink",
    "google.logging.v2.ConfigServiceV2.UpdateSink"
]);
GCPAuditLogs
| where TimeGenerated > ago(2h)
| where MethodName in (suspicious_methods) or MethodName has_any ("SetIamPolicy", "DeleteSink", "UpdateSink")
| extend CallerIp = tostring(parse_json(RequestMetadata).callerIp)
| where CallerIp !startswith "10." and CallerIp !startswith "192.168."
| summarize
    EventSequence = make_set(MethodName),
    EventCount = count(),
    FirstEvent = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastEvent = max(TimeGenerated),
    SourceIPs = make_set(CallerIp),
    TargetResources = make_set(GCPResourceName)
    by PrincipalEmail, ProjectId
| where EventCount >= 3
| where set_has_element(EventSequence, "google.iam.admin.v1.CreateServiceAccount") or set_has_element(EventSequence, "SetIamPolicy") or EventSequence has "DeleteSink" or EventSequence has "UpdateSink"
| extend DurationMin = datetime_diff('minute', LastEvent, FirstEvent)
| project
    FirstEvent,
    LastEvent,
    DurationMin,
    PrincipalEmail,
    ProjectId,
    EventSequence,
    EventCount,
    SourceIPs,
    TargetResources
| extend
    TimeGenerated = FirstEvent,
    AccountUpn = PrincipalEmail,
    RemoteIP = tostring(SourceIPs[0]),
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(PrincipalEmail, ProjectId, tostring(EventCount), tostring(FirstEvent))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 9 - GCP IAM privilege escalation and resource abuse
alertTemplate.description: A GCP principal created service accounts, modified IAM policies, opened firewall rules, spun up compute instances, or disabled logging sinks from an external IP. Stage 9 of the Lab attack chain (T1136.003, T1098, T1496, T1562.008).

displayName: Lab Stage 10 Phishing Emails Bypassing MailGuard365

queryCondition.queryText:
MailGuard365_Threats_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(1h)
| where ThreatVerdict == "Phishing" and Action == "Allow"
| where toint(ThreatConfidence) >= 80
| extend SenderDomainLower = tolower(SenderDomain)
| summarize
    PhishCount = count(),
    Subjects = make_set(Subject),
    TargetRecipients = make_set(RecipientAddress),
    SenderAddresses = make_set(SenderAddress),
    SenderIPs = make_set(SenderIP),
    AvgConfidence = avg(toint(ThreatConfidence)),
    MaliciousUrls = make_set(Urls),
    MaliciousAttachments = make_set(AttachmentName),
    FirstSeen = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastSeen = max(TimeGenerated)
    by SenderDomainLower
| where PhishCount >= 2
| project
    FirstSeen,
    LastSeen,
    SenderDomainLower,
    PhishCount,
    AvgConfidence,
    SenderAddresses,
    SenderIPs,
    TargetRecipients,
    Subjects,
    MaliciousUrls,
    MaliciousAttachments
| extend
    TimeGenerated = FirstSeen,
    AccountUpn = tostring(TargetRecipients[0]),
    RemoteIP = tostring(SenderIPs[0]),
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(SenderDomainLower, tostring(PhishCount), tostring(FirstSeen))))

alertTemplate.title: Lab Stage 10 - Phishing campaign bypassed MailGuard365 email filtering
alertTemplate.description: Multiple phishing emails from the same sender domain were allowed through to recipient mailboxes despite high-confidence phishing verdicts from MailGuard365. Stage 10 of the Lab attack chain (T1566.001, T1566.002).

displayName: Lab [E1] [Threat Intel] IOC Match Across Sources
description: EXERCISE: Cross-source threat intelligence correlation. This rule matches known IOC IP addresses and file hashes from the Lab attack scenario against all five data sources using a union query. Students should review the TI indicators in threat-intelligence/indicators.json and understand how IOC matching works across heterogeneous log formats.

queryCondition.queryText:
let ioc_ips = dynamic(["198.51.100.42", "203.0.113.77", "192.0.2.100"]);
let ioc_hashes = dynamic(["e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855"]);
union
    (CommonSecurityLog
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
    | where DeviceVendor == "Palo Alto Networks"
    | where SourceIP in (ioc_ips) or DestinationIP in (ioc_ips)
    | extend MatchedIOC = iff(DestinationIP in (ioc_ips), DestinationIP, SourceIP)
    | project TimeGenerated, DataSource = "PaloAlto", MatchedIOC, IOCType = "ip", Activity, SourceUserName, SourceHostName),
    (AWSCloudTrail
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
    | where SourceIpAddress in (ioc_ips)
    | project TimeGenerated, DataSource = "AWS", MatchedIOC = SourceIpAddress, IOCType = "ip", Activity = EventName, SourceUserName = UserIdentityUserName, SourceHostName = ""),
    (OktaV2_CL
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
    | where SrcIpAddr in (ioc_ips)
    | project TimeGenerated, DataSource = "Okta", MatchedIOC = SrcIpAddr, IOCType = "ip", Activity = EventOriginalType, SourceUserName = ActorUsername, SourceHostName = ""),
    (MailGuard365_Threats_CL
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
    | where SenderIP in (ioc_ips)
    | project TimeGenerated, DataSource = "MailGuard", MatchedIOC = SenderIP, IOCType = "ip", Activity = "Phishing Email", SourceUserName = RecipientAddress, SourceHostName = ""),
    (CrowdStrikeDetections
    | where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
    | where Sha256 in (ioc_hashes) or tostring(Device.external_ip) in (ioc_ips)
    | extend MatchedIOC = iff(Sha256 in (ioc_hashes), Sha256, tostring(Device.external_ip))
    | extend IOCType = iff(Sha256 in (ioc_hashes), "hash", "ip")
    | project TimeGenerated, DataSource = "CrowdStrike", MatchedIOC, IOCType, Activity = Name, SourceUserName = SourceAccountUpn, SourceHostName = tostring(Device.hostname))
| extend
    AccountUpn = SourceUserName,
    DeviceName = SourceHostName,
    RemoteIP = iff(IOCType == "ip", MatchedIOC, ""),
    SHA256 = iff(IOCType == "hash", MatchedIOC, ""),
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(DataSource, MatchedIOC, tostring(TimeGenerated))))

alertTemplate.title: IOC match in {{DataSource}} — {{MatchedIOC}} [Threat Intel]
alertTemplate.description: A known indicator of compromise (IP address or file hash) from the Lab threat intelligence feed was observed in one or more data sources.
alertTemplate.recommendedActions: Investigate the matched IOC. Determine the source and scope of exposure. Cross-reference with the attack timeline in the Lab scenario.

description: EXERCISE: Detects network port scanning activity from Palo Alto firewall logs. Identifies hosts scanning more than 20 unique ports against a single destination, using dropped/denied connections with incomplete application protocol as indicators. Students should tune the threshold and time window.

queryCondition.queryText:
CommonSecurityLog
| where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
| where DeviceVendor == "Palo Alto Networks"
| where DeviceEventClassID == "TRAFFIC"
| where Activity in ("drop", "deny", "reset-both")
| where ApplicationProtocol == "incomplete"
| summarize
    DistinctPorts = dcount(DestinationPort),
    PortList = make_set(DestinationPort, 25),
    EventCount = count(),
    FirstSeen = min(TimeGenerated),
    LastSeen = max(TimeGenerated)
    by SourceIP, DestinationIP, SourceHostName, SourceUserName
| where DistinctPorts > 20
| project
    FirstSeen,
    LastSeen,
    SourceIP,
    DestinationIP,
    DistinctPorts,
    PortList,
    EventCount,
    SourceHostName,
    SourceUserName
| extend
    TimeGenerated = FirstSeen,
    AccountUpn = SourceUserName,
    DeviceName = SourceHostName,
    RemoteIP = DestinationIP,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(SourceIP, DestinationIP, tostring(DistinctPorts))))

alertTemplate.title: Port scan from {{DeviceName}} — {{DistinctPorts}} ports [Palo Alto]
alertTemplate.description: An internal host scanned more than 20 unique ports on a single destination, indicated by dropped/denied connections with incomplete application protocol. This is consistent with reconnaissance activity (T1046).
alertTemplate.recommendedActions: Investigate the source host for compromise. Check if the destination is a legitimate service. Review recent endpoint detection alerts for the source host.

description: EXERCISE: Detects Okta MFA factor deactivation, reset, or modification events. Requires re-ingestion of attack data to include the MFA deactivation event (added to the attack scenario generator after the initial data was ingested). Students should enable this rule after running a fresh attack simulation.

queryCondition.queryText:
OktaV2_CL
| where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
| where EventOriginalType in ("user.mfa.factor.deactivate", "user.mfa.factor.reset_all", "user.mfa.factor.update")
| where OriginalOutcomeResult == "SUCCESS"
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    ActorUsername,
    SrcIpAddr,
    SrcGeoCountry,
    SrcGeoCity,
    EventOriginalType,
    EventMessage
| extend
    AccountUpn = ActorUsername,
    RemoteIP = SrcIpAddr,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(ActorUsername, EventOriginalType, tostring(TimeGenerated))))

alertTemplate.title: MFA factor manipulation by {{ActorUsername}} [Okta]
alertTemplate.description: An Okta user's MFA factor was deactivated, reset, or modified. This may indicate credential compromise followed by MFA bypass (T1556.006).
alertTemplate.recommendedActions: Verify the MFA change was authorized. Suspend the user account if unauthorized. Re-enroll MFA factors. Investigate the source IP for other suspicious activity.

description: EXERCISE: Detect AWS console logins without MFA, enriched with a watchlist join. Students should create a BusinessCriticalAWS watchlist CSV (columns: EventSource, ServiceName, Criticality) and modify the query to join _GetWatchlist('BusinessCriticalAWS') to flag whether the login affected a critical AWS service. This demonstrates watchlist integration in custom detections.

queryCondition.queryText:
AWSCloudTrail
| where TimeGenerated > ago(4h)
| where EventName == "ConsoleLogin"
| where SessionMfaAuthenticated != "true"
| project
    TimeGenerated,
    UserIdentityUserName,
    SourceIpAddress,
    AWSRegion,
    EventName,
    MfaAuthenticated = SessionMfaAuthenticated,
    UserIdentityArn
| extend
    AccountUpn = strcat(UserIdentityUserName, "@pkwork.onmicrosoft.com"),
    RemoteIP = SourceIpAddress,
    ReportId = tostring(hash_sha256(strcat(UserIdentityUserName, SourceIpAddress, tostring(TimeGenerated))))

alertTemplate.title: Console login without MFA by {{UserIdentityUserName}} [AWS]
alertTemplate.description: An AWS console login was detected without MFA authentication. This is a high-risk configuration that may indicate compromised credentials (T1078.004).
alertTemplate.recommendedActions: Enforce MFA on the IAM user. Review recent API activity for the user. Check if the login is from an expected IP and region.
